text.section: Except as provided in subsection (b) of this section, the circuit court shall review the decision of a board of appeals or a hearing examiner under this subtitle on the record transmitted by the board of appeals or hearing examiner, and not de novo.

section.section:
If, after a hearing, the circuit court determines that testimony is needed for the proper disposition of the matter, the court may take evidence or appoint a special master to:
take the required evidence; and
report the evidence to the court with the special master's findings of fact and conclusions of law.
The special master's evidence, findings, and conclusions shall constitute a part of the proceedings on which the court shall make its determination.
